}} 'United' is a British television film directed by James Strong and written by
Chris Chibnall. It is based on the true story of Manchester United's "Busby
Babes" and the aftermath of the 1958 Munich air disaster, with the film's events
taking place between August 1956 and May 1958. In particular, the film focuses
on the experiences of assistant manager Jimmy Murphy, played by David Tennant,
and Bobby Charlton, played by Jack O'Connell.

Largely filmed around the North East of England, the film was first broadcast on
24 April 2011 on BBC Two and BBC HD, but is being sold
internationally as a theatrical picture by Content Media Corp.
The series gained a 14.3% rating in its time slot and was generally well
received by television critics.
